name: Mixed Bag 23 Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Tough [E] | 10 Questions

questions.text: How many engines does a B-52 airplane have?
questions.explanation:
8.

	The B-52 is made by Boeing. It was named the Stratofortress and first flew October 3,1952. It has remained in service for more than 40 years.

questions.text: Who won a gold record for her recording of 'Ode To Billie Joe'?
questions.explanation:
Bobbie Gentry.

	Teresa was known as the ' little lady with the uniquely big voice'.

questions.text: In which country did the October Revolution take place?
questions.explanation:
Russia.

	It was the 2nd Russian revolution in 1917. It opened October 24th and 25th. It was also called the Bolshevik Revolution.

questions.text: To go home where would Greta Garbo purchase a plane ticket to?
questions.explanation:
Sweden.

	She was born Greta Gustaffson in Stockholm.

questions.text: Lee Marvin once starred as a tough detective on what television show?
questions.explanation:
M Squad.

	Ran from September 1957 to September 1960.The city was Chicago, his name Lt. Frank Ballinger.

questions.text: Who was the captain in 'Mutiny On The Bounty'?
questions.explanation:
Lieutenant Bligh.

	Lieutenant William Bligh (later Captain William Bligh) was played by Charles Laughton and his first mate Fletcher Christian was played by Clark Gable.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a name for a primitive doctor?
questions.explanation:
Pariah.

	The Pariahs were a group of outcast people expelled for religious or social sins. Most were employed as servants.

questions.text: Which of the following is not addressed as 'The Honorable'?
questions.explanation:
Vice President.

	The Vice President is addressed as Mr. Vice President or Excellency.

questions.text: In what year were golf balls first mass produced?
Who was Eddie Fisher's third wife?
questions.explanation:
Connie Stevens.

	Debbie was his first wife in 1955 followed three years later by Elizabeth. Judy was never his wife.
